intro: Zygogynum tieghemii subsp. tieghemii, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, often reddish bark. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
